column4: Hello, recently, the a button, when I press it, writes down something like adsf and lowers the volume.
sounds more like a stuck gummey key on your keyboard
how can I fix it? it showed up yesterday first time
sorry, I think I may be answering too many people and lost track ;-)
I have the problem with pressing "a" and getting "afsd" and lower sound volume (I think only when VLC or YouTube is open)...
I have the problem with pressing "a" and getting "afsd" and lower sound volume (I think only when VLC or YouTube is open)...
aah, the potential keyboard problem. Do you have another keyboard you can plug in and test ?
I never had this problem until yesterday
the only idea I have is that it sounds like a broken or dirty keyboard with one or more of the keys sticking.
it is a laptop keyboard, so, I shouldn't remove any keys for cleaning, right?

so you need to eliminate that possibility. One way is to plug in another keyboard. If it works, then you know it is your keyboard. If the problem persists then we would have to look elsewhere. since you do not have naother one, then the only other thing I can think of is to try and clean the keybaord and make sure there is nothing stuck between keys etc.
I am not a hardware person so I have no idea about laptop keyboards so yes I would advise caution removing anything. A lot of keyboards are usb these days, a frined have one you can borrow ?
if you really suspect software as the problem, then why don't you boot it from a live-cd
Dr_Willis: OK, thank you, I 'll try what you both suggested.
